intro: Satureja ekmaniana, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and produces small, pink or purple flowers in the summer. Its leaves are fragrant and have been used in traditional herbal medicine for their antimicrobial properties. Satureja ekmaniana thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant suitable for rocky or alpine gardens.
